title: Mind melding: Understanding the connected, social brain

title_detail.value: Mind melding: Understanding the connected, social brain

summary: Parents may often feel like they are not 'on the same wavelength' as their kids. But it turns out that, at least for babies, their brainwaves literally sync with their moms when they are learning from them. In a new study, researchers found that how well babies' neural activity syncs with their moms' predicts how well they learn social cues about new toys.
